skill.name: data-quality-frameworks
skill.description: Implement data quality validation with Great Expectations, dbt tests, and data contracts. Use when building data quality pipelines, implementing validation rules, or establishing data contracts.
skill.summary: Implement data quality validation with Great Expectations, dbt tests, and data contracts. Use when b...

security_audit.summary: No malicious behaviors or suspicious access patterns were found. The content is documentation and example code only.

content.value_statement: Data quality issues cause failed analytics and broken pipelines. This skill provides proven Great Expectations, dbt tests, and data contract patterns to prevent them.
actual_capabilities: Provide Great Expectations suite examples with common expectations
Show checkpoint configuration and failure handling patterns
Define dbt schema tests and custom test templates
Outline data contract structure with quality checks
Sketch an automated quality pipeline with reporting
limitations: Examples are templates and require adaptation to your data sources
No packaged code or install scripts are included
Does not provide runtime monitoring or alerting integrations

use_cases.title: Build validation suites
use_cases.description: Create Great Expectations suites and checkpoints for warehouse tables.

use_cases.title: Expand dbt testing
use_cases.description: Add schema, column, and custom dbt tests for marts.

use_cases.title: Define data contracts
use_cases.description: Specify contracts with schema, quality checks, and SLAs.

prompt_templates.title: Starter checks
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a basic Great Expectations suite for an orders table with primary key, status, amount, and created_at checks.

prompt_templates.title: dbt test plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft dbt tests for fct_orders and dim_customers including recency, relationships, and accepted values.

prompt_templates.title: Contract spec
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a data contract outline for an orders dataset with schema, quality checks, and SLAs.

prompt_templates.title: Pipeline pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Describe an automated data quality pipeline that runs suites for multiple tables and generates a report.

output_examples.input: Give me a minimal Great Expectations suite for orders data.
output: Defines required columns and primary key checks
Validates status values and amount range
Adds freshness and row count checks

best_practices: Start with critical columns and expand tests over time
Document expectations and ownership for each dataset
Alert on failures and review trends regularly
anti_patterns: Skipping freshness checks for event data

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude and Codex?
faq.answer: Yes, the content is plain text examples and works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: Are there limits on dataset size?
faq.answer: The templates do not impose limits, but performance depends on your warehouse and test design.

faq.question: Can it integrate with CI or orchestration tools?
faq.answer: It provides patterns that you can adapt for CI pipelines or schedulers.

faq.question: Does it access or store sensitive data?
faq.answer: No, it only provides documentation and example code snippets.

faq.question: What if a check fails unexpectedly?
faq.answer: Review recent data changes, adjust thresholds, and confirm source freshness.

faq.question: How does this compare to a full framework setup?
faq.answer: It is guidance and templates, not a prebuilt framework or package.
